args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". State attorneys general say they will sue to block pause on federal grants At least 20 states have been frozen out of their Medicaid reimbursement systems after the Trump administration ordered a pause in federal grant spending, attorneys general said Tuesday. The attorneys general said they would file a lawsuit to block the federal grant directive, which they said has already led to frozen funds for programs including Medicaid, Head Start in Michigan and child development block grants in Maryland. “We will not stand for any illegal policy that puts essential services for millions of Americans at risk,” New York Attorney General Letitia James (D) said at a news conference also attended by her Democratic peers from several other states. White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt, however, said on social media that the Medicaid website portal had suffered an outage, but that Medicaid payments had not been affected and the portal would be “back online shortly.”
result: No. This text appears to describe a hypothetical or potential future scenario, not an actual, confirmed action already taken by the Trump administration. The language suggests this is a speculative discussion about potential legal action by state attorneys general.
